intro: Eriosema lejeunei, commonly known as the silverleaf eriosema, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant features a hairy stem and leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Eriosema lejeunei is often found in open woodlands and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
